questions.question: The most applicable failure theory for metals like aluminium is
Which one of the following is FALSE?
options: Number of Taps generally used for hand taping is 3
Piispanen's model in machining is used to estimate shear strain
Chip hammering during machining is due to improper chip control
Cemented carbide tools are generally poor in compression
questions.answer: Cemented carbide tools are generally poor in compression

Which of the following is FALSE?
options: Heat flow by conduction is directly proportional to the area and temperature gradient
Heat flow by convection is directly proportional to the area and temperature difference
Heat flow by radiation is directly proportional to the cube of absolute temperature of the radiating body
Emissivity of perfect black body is unity
questions.answer: Heat flow by radiation is directly proportional to the cube of absolute temperature of the radiating body

questions.question:
Two dimensionally equal blocks made of material M1 and M2 are placed on a flat horizontal surface as shown in figure below. Young's modulus of the materials are E1 & E2 resp. A uniform pressure 'p' is applied over the blocks through a thick plate (AB) symmetrically placed over the blocks. For E1 > E2, consider the statements below.
(p) Stress in both blocks are same
(q) Strain in both blocks are same
(r) Plate AB tilts and point B moves downward
(s) Plate AB tilts and point A moves downward
Which of the above statements are correct?
In tolerancing of a part, unless otherwise specified, individual features of size must
options: not violate size limits of MMC at any cross section
not violate an envelope of perfect form at LMC
not violate an envelope of perfect form at MMC
questions.answer: not violate an envelope of perfect form at MMC

Which of the following is FALSE for bolted joints?
options: Bolted joints are preloaded to abode vibration loosening
Threads made by thread rolling process are preferred over machined threads in bolts
When external load is applied to a preloaded bolt joint, a bigger percentage of that load relieves compression of flanges and remaining percentage increases tension in bolts
Bolted joints are designed such that bolt stiffness is higher than flange stiffness
questions.answer: Bolted joints are designed such that bolt stiffness is higher than flange stiffness

questions.question: Thumb rule between feed and nose radius in rough turning is
Which of the following is FALSE?
options: A reverted gear train is one in which the first and last gears are on the same axis.
Train value for a gear is the ratio of product of driven tooth numbers to product of driving tooth numbers.
A planetary gear train is one in which the axes of some of the gears may have a motion.
A compound gear train is one which has two or more gears on each axis.
questions.answer: Train value for a gear is the ratio of product of driven tooth numbers to product of driving tooth numbers.

questions.question: Which of the following is true for ductile materials?
options: Engineering stress-strain curve cannot have negative slope
Most applicable failure theory is maximum principal stress theory
Ultimate strain is the strain at ultimate stress
Strain hardening is represented by a negative slope in engineering stress strain curve
questions.answer: Ultimate strain is the strain at ultimate stress

questions.question: The specific metal cutting energy is expressed as
For isotropic materials, the modulus of Elasticity in tension and shear (E and G) are relate to the Poisson's ratio (v) as follows
Which of the following is NOT true?
options: For direct impact of two bodies, coefficient of restitution is the ratio of relative velocity of approach of the two bodies to their relative velocity of separation
Conservation of angular momentum implies that total angular momentum of system remains constant unless acted on by an external torque
Conservation of linear momentum in a given direction implies that the sum of external forces in that direction is zero
The coefficient of friction is independent of area of contact
questions.answer: For direct impact of two bodies, coefficient of restitution is the ratio of relative velocity of approach of the two bodies to their relative velocity of separation

it is used to obtain extremely high wear resistant surfaces on steels

If the vessel tilts by 0.01 radians by moving a 50 kg carton from the centre by a distance of 2 m towards side in horizontal direction, the metacentric height of the vessel is (g = 10 m/s²)
Which of the following is TRUE for vibration of a mechanical system
options: Damping ratio (ξ) is the ratio of the critical damping to the actual damping
The damping can be obtained from the response of the system under forced vibration using logarithmic decrement method
For damped mechanical systems, the amplitude of vibration tends to become infinity when excitation frequency (ω) reaches the system's natural frequency (ωₙ)
Amplitude ratio and transmissibility of a vibration isolator is unity when the frequency of exciting force is √2 times the natural frequency
questions.answer: Amplitude ratio and transmissibility of a vibration isolator is unity when the frequency of exciting force is √2 times the natural frequency

questions.question: What is the maximum rate that a heat pump which uses 1 kW of electric power can supply heat to a house at 27⁰C when the outside temperature is 12⁰C

A cantilever beam of rectangular cross section (depth 'd', width 'b' & length 'L') is subjected to a shear force 'F' at its free end as shown in figure. The beam is made of material which follows maximum shear stress theory. Which of the following is TRUE?
options: The beam section has a uniform shear stress, F/bd
Maximum shear stress in section and maximum bending stress in beam is equal when L = d/2
For L > d/2, bending stress decides the failure stress
Bending stress developed in the beam is independent of 'b'
questions.answer: For L > d/2, bending stress decides the failure stress

questions.question: A jet engine consumes 1 kg of fuel for each 40 kg of air intake. Fuel consumption is 1 kg/sec. When aircraft travels in still air at 200 m/sec. velocity of discharge gases with respect to engine is 700 m/sec. The power developed by engine is
Which of the following is most appropriate for vapour power cycles?
options: In Carnot cycle, expansion of vapour occur without change in entropy
In Rankine cycle, transformation of liquid water in steam generator occurs at constant temperature
In Carnot cycle heating of vapor occurs at constant volume
In Rankine cycle, entropy of vapor increases during its expansion in steam turbine
questions.answer: In Carnot cycle, expansion of vapour occur without change in entropy
